010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012/**
013 * This thresholder implements the algorithm proposed by Ridler and Calvard (1978),
014 * T.W. Ridler, S. Calvard, Picture thresholding using an iterative selection method,
015 * IEEE Trans. System, Man and Cybernetics, SMC-8 (August 1978) 630-632.
016 * described in Glasbey/Horgan: "Image Analysis for the Biological Sciences" (Ch. 4).
017 * 
018 * Fast version using tables of background and foreground means.
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2022/08/01
022 */
023public class IsodataThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
024        
025        private int MAX_ITERATIONS = 100;
026
027        private double[] M0 = null;             // table of background means
028        private double[] M1 = null;             // table of foreground means
029        
030        public IsodataThresholder() {
031                super();
032        }
033
034        @Override
035        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
036                makeMeanTables(h);
037                int K = h.length;
038                int q = (int) M0[K-1];  // start with total mean
039                int q_;
040                
041                int i = 0;
042                do {
043                        i++; 
044                        if (M0[q]<0 || M1[q]<0)  // background or foreground is empty
045                                return -1;
046                        q_ = q;                         
047                        q = (int) ((M0[q] + M1[q])/2);
048                } while (q != q_ && i < MAX_ITERATIONS);
049                
050                return q;
051        }
052        
053        private void makeMeanTables(int[] h) {
054                int K = h.length;
055                M0 = new double[K];
056                M1 = new double[K];
057                int n0 = 0;
058                long s0 = 0;
059                for (int q = 0; q < K; q++) {
060                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
061                        s0 = s0 + q * h[q];
062                        M0[q] = (n0 > 0) ? ((double) s0)/n0 : -1;
063                }
064//              int N = n0;
065                
066                int n1 = 0;
067                long s1 = 0;
068                M1[K-1] = 0;
069                for (int q = h.length-2; q >= 0; q--) {
070                        n1 = n1 + h[q+1];
071                        s1 = s1 + (q+1) * h[q+1];
072                        M1[q] = (n1 > 0) ? ((double) s1)/n1 : -1;
073                }
074                
075//              return N;
076        }
077        
078}
